page.title: 17Village Changes.
page.content: Stainforth received its market charter in (1346/1348). The village grew up around the market area alongside the River Don. Sheffield and South Yorkshire canal runs through the village and was the centre of activity before the mine was sunk in 1916. Trains travelled down Princess Avenue between the pit and the canal,where barges would remove or deliver the goods. Nowadays canal traffic is mostly for leisure. A disco boat comes once a year in the summer. The greatest change in Stainforth over the last seventy years,since the first coal was found ,has to be the vast planned estate of Coal Board housing, which dominates the village. Many older properties can be found along the canal bank.
